citations.narrative:
The records of Animals on Hand and records of Acquisition, Disposition or Transport of Animals were incomplete at the
time of inspection containing only the number and species of animals. Every dealer and exhibitor shall make, keep, and
maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning all animals purchased or otherwise
acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. These records shall include i. the
name and address of the person from whom the animals were purchased or otherwise acquired; ii. the USDA license or
registration number of the peron if licensed or registered; iii. the vehicle license number and state, and the driver's license
number and state of the person, if not licensed or registered; iv. The name and address of the person to whom an animal
was sold or given; v. the date of purchase, acquisition, sale, or disposal of the animal(s); vi. the species of the animal(s);
and vii. the number of animals in the shipment. These records are necessary to assess the health and well-being of the
animals on site and allow tracking of animals being used for regulatory purposes. These records must be completed and
made available to APHIS upon request.
To be corrected by February 24, 2025.
This inspection and initial exit interview were conducted with the facility representative on February 3, 2025. A final verbal
exit interview was conducted with the facility representative on February 7, 2025.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The records of Animals on Hand and records of Acquisition, Disposition or Transport of Animals were incomplete at the 
time of inspection containing only the number and species of animals. Every dealer and exhibitor shall make, keep, and 
maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning all animals purchased or otherwise 
acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. These records shall include i. the 
name and address of the person from whom the animals were purchased or otherwise acquired; ii. the USDA license or 
registration number of the peron if licensed or registered; iii. the vehicle license number and state, and the driver's license 
number and state of the person, if not licensed or registered; iv. The name and address of the person to whom an animal 
was sold or given; v. the date of purchase, acquisition, sale, or disposal of the animal(s); vi. the species of the animal(s); 
and vii. the number of animals in the shipment. These records are necessary to assess the health and well-being of the 
animals on site and allow tracking of animals being used for regulatory purposes. These records must be completed and 
made available to APHIS upon request. 
 
To be corrected by February 24, 2025. 
 
This inspection and initial exit interview were conducted with the facility representative on February 3, 2025. A final verbal 
exit interview was conducted with the facility representative on February 7, 2025. 
 
 n
